acceptTreasury().details: Can only be called by the pending treasury address

cancelRedemption(address,uint256).details: Implements redemption cancellation model from whitepaper Section 4.2

params.queueIndex: Index of redemption request to cancel

params.assets: Amount of assets to convert (in base asset decimals)

params.shares: Amount of shares to convert (18 decimals)

returns.assets: Amount of assets (in base asset decimals)

deposit(address,address,uint256,address,.details: Implements deposit model from whitepaper Section 4.1Deposits can be in any whitelisted asset, converted to base asset value via oraclereferralCode is optional and can be bytes32(0) if not provided

params.asset: Asset address (must be whitelisted, can be different from vault base asset)
params.referralCode: Optional referral partner code (keccak hash, bytes32)

returns.shares: Amount of shares minted (net of fees)

disableAsset(address,address).details: This is curator only function. Operator can whitelist/blacklist assets using setAssetWhitelist function.

getRedemptionQueueLength(address).details: Returns total requests, not active entries (some may have been processed/cancelled)

params.priceOracle_: Price oracle contract address (can be address(0) initially)

isBlacklisted(address).details: Checks centralized blacklist status from Administrator contract

returns.paused: True if vault is paused or global pause is active

paused().details: Checks centralized global pause status from Administrator contract

processRedemption(address,uint256,uint25.details: Implements redemption settlement model from whitepaper Section 4.2Redemptions are always in base asset (unlike deposits which can be in any whitelisted asset)Gas fees are deducted from netShares and transferred to treasury

params.gasFeeShares: Gas fees in shares to deduct from redemption
params.queueIndex: Index of redemption request to process

requestRedemption(address,uint256,addres.details: Implements redemption request model from whitepaper Section 4.2If owner != msg.sender, caller must have allowance to spend owner's shares

params.owner: Owner of the shares (must have sufficient balance, or caller must have allowance)
params.receiver: Address to receive the redemption assets

rescueTokens(address,address,uint256).details: Allows admin to recover tokens accidentally sent to this contract

params.amount: Amount of tokens to rescue (0 for full balance)
params.to: Address to send rescued tokens to
params.token: Token address to rescue (address(0) for native ETH)

params._administrator: Address of the new administrator contract

params.status: True to whitelist, false to blacklist

setContracts(address,address,address,add.details: EMERGENCY FUNCTION: Used only in emergency situations to update contract addresses. Generally, these addresses are set once during initialization and should not be changed. This function allows emergency operators to update contract addresses in case of critical issues such as contract upgrades or emergency migrations.

params.priceOracle_: Price oracle contract address (can be address(0) initially)

setMaxNavChangePercent(uint256).details: Set to 0 to disable the guardrail

params.maxNavChangePercent_: Maximum NAV change percentage (18 decimals, e.g., 10e16 = 10%)

setPriceOracle(address).details: This is operator only function. Curator can set price oracle using setPriceOracle function.

params.treasury_: New treasury address (must accept to complete transfer)

totalAssets(address).details: Reuses convertVaultSharesToAssets to calculate total assetsReturns 0 if NAV is not initialized or totalSupply is 0

returns._0: Total assets in base asset (in base asset decimals)

params.managementFee: Management fee amount in shares (18 decimals)
params.performanceFee: Performance fee amount in shares (18 decimals)

administrator().notice: Administrator contract address for role management

convertVaultAssetsToShares(address,uint2.notice: Convert assets to shares for a vault using current NAV

convertVaultSharesToAssets(address,uint2.notice: Convert shares to assets for a vault using current NAV

deposit(address,address,uint256,address,.notice: Deposit assets into a vault (supports multi-asset deposits)

disableAsset(address,address).notice: Disable asset whitelist for a vault

getRedemptionQueueEntry(address,uint256).notice: Get redemption queue entry for a vault

getRedemptionQueueLength(address).notice: Get total redemption requests ever made for a vault

getStandardDebt(address).notice: Get Standard Debt for a vault

getVaultAsset(address).notice: Get the base asset address for a vault

isBlacklisted(address).notice: Returns the blacklist status of an address from Administrator

isVault(address).notice: Check if an address is a registered vault (delegates to Registry)

isVaultPaused(address).notice: Check if a vault is paused (checks both vault-level and global pause)

isWhitelisted(address,address).notice: Whitelisted assets per vault: vault => asset => isWhitelisted

maxNavChangePercent().notice: Maximum NAV change percentage per update (18 decimals, e.g., 10e16 = 10%)

nextQueueIndex(address).notice: Next queue index per vault (monotonic counter, never decrements)

paused().notice: Returns the paused status of this contract from Administrator

redemptionQueues(address,uint256).notice: Redemption queue per vault: vault => queue index => queue entry

requestRedemption(address,uint256,addres.notice: Request redemption by locking shares and adding to queue

rescueTokens(address,address,uint256).notice: Rescue ERC20 tokens locked in this contract

setAssetWhitelist(address,address,bool).notice: Whitelist or blacklist an asset for a vault

setContracts(address,address,address,add.notice: Set all contract addresses at once (EMERGENCY ONLY)

setMaxNavChangePercent(uint256).notice: Set maximum NAV change percentage guardrail (only operator)

standardDebt(address).notice: Standard Debt per vault (redemption obligations in shares)

totalAssets(address).notice: Get total assets managed by a vault (ERC4626-compatible)

updateNav(address,uint256,uint256,uint25.notice: Update NAV and mint management/performance fees (only operator)

documentation.text: @notice Structure to hold all contract addresses
@notice All contract addresses grouped together
@notice Treasury address (protocol treasury)
@notice Pending treasury address (two-step transfer)

@notice Whitelisted assets per vault: vault => asset => isWhitelisted
 @dev key: vault (address), nested key: asset (address), value: isWhitelisted (bool)
@notice Redemption queue entry structure

@notice Redemption queue per vault: vault => queue index => queue entry
 @dev key: vault (address), nested key: queueIndex (uint256), value: queueEntry (RedemptionQueueEntry)

@notice Maximum NAV change percentage per update (18 decimals, e.g., 10e16 = 10%)
 @dev Guardrail to prevent excessive NAV changes in a single update

@dev Storage gap for upgradeable contracts
 CRITICAL: Update gap when adding/removing state variables
 Current usage:
 - contracts: 4 slots (struct with 4 fields)
 - isWhitelisted: 1 slot (mapping)
 - redemptionQueues: 1 slot (mapping)
 - nextQueueIndex: 1 slot (mapping)
 - standardDebt: 1 slot (mapping)
 - treasury: 1 slot
 - pendingTreasury: 1 slot
 - maxNavChangePercent: 1 slot
 - AccessControl parent: ~1 slot (administrator)
 - Gap: 72 - 11 = 61 slots remaining
 Note: _gap follows OpenZeppelin's standard pattern for upgradeable contracts
 Note: userDeposits and totalDeposits are now stored in LimitsFeature contract
@custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor
